programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 1:

An in-depth look at the secrets of the French luxury industry, and earrings for men. The Marseilles collective Laissez Passer recycles below-standard and abandoned harbour materials. How to wear satin, whatever the occasion. The association Fleurs d'Halage offers a second life to polluted areas of Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: 1980s inspirations We rediscover the culinary culture of the 1980s with our idols: Mario Pelchat, Martine St-Clair and Sonia Benezra. The chef Julien Phavorachith explores the emblematic dishes of the day. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Cédric Kahn, l'échappée
programme.desc: We head off on a journey with French actor and director Cédric Kahn, a voyage to explore the settings for some of his films. From one encounter to another, he leads us towards what lies at the very heart of his cinema. Directed by: Alexandre Hilaire (France, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Éric heads to Béarn and the largest colony of vultures in the Pyrenees. In Saint-Nazaire, Julie visits the famous Atlantic shipyards. Cyril has discovered a delicious sweet treat near Saumur: a dried pear known as a "poire tapée". In Champagne, Carine immerses herself in the history of Lake Der. Presented by: Éric Perrin, Julie Hattu, Cyril Hue, Carine Aigon.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Haut-Doubs In the heart of the Haut-Doubs, Anne-Sophie and Arnaud Bourgeois make a liqueur with a demonic reputation: absinthe. Antoine Vernerey produces Comté, an age-old variety of AOC cheese. Geneviève Magnon excavates peat bogs for a veritable journey back in time. Focus on an exceptional product: the Morteau sausage. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.desc: "Côté vigne" Sophie Menut is in Alsace, aiming for Kientzheim, where she will meet two sisters, Anne-Cécile and Marie. It's mid-November: Anne-Cécile is waiting for her in the vineyard, ready for the late harvest, while Marie is expecting her in her "Côté vigne" restaurant, poised to cook a roasted pineapple cookie with chocolate chantilly. Presentation: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.desc: Sautéed scallops, parsley roots and Granny Smith apples The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.sub-title: Ne pas tricher avec la nature
programme.desc: Don't cheat with nature Tanguy Collet decided to change his life and dedicate it to bee-keeping. The nursery growers raising awareness amongst schoolchildren about how climate change will affect the forests. In Cannes, Marina Picasso invites us into the garden of the Villa Californie, redesigned by landscape architect Jean Mus. Don't panic: Thibaud's garden. Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: En route vers les sommets
programme.desc:
Bivouac life at sub-zero temperatures

It's the last chance for the first group to convince the guides of their skills. One of the roped parties struggles to find a way up while the other tackles a highly technical rock face. After a 10-hour day they must now spend the night outside at -10 degrees.

Director: Martin Schilt (season 2, Switzerland, 2021)

programme.title: Vachement Normand !
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken pizzas and a honey-miso salmon bowl
Two recipes for easy meals that don't compromise on taste: chicken pizza on butter naan bread and a quick honey-miso marinated salmon bowl.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc: The last resort On the Crozon Peninsula, the Flotille 33F helicopter squadron specialises in rescue missions. At the controls of their giant Caiman helicopters, the handful of pilots are ready to intervene day or night, whatever the weather, or almost. They offer a last hope for sailors in danger, the last resort. Report by: Grégoire Gosset. Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: An invitation to explore behind the scenes at the Villa Arnaga in Combo-les-Bains, built by Edmond Rostand. An elegant immersion in the world of the designer Valentine Gauthier. A journey through Paris to discover the best Portuguese addresses. Focus on the sculptor Franck Espagnet who gives new life to driftwood. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Rouleaux de printemps et sauces vietnamiennes
programme.desc: Spring rolls and Vietnamese sauces Ross Louangsignotha offers some invaluable advice for making successful spring rolls with prawns and smoked meat. And for the perfect finishing touch, two easy to make Vietnamese sauces. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Nos maisons
programme.desc: Shoebox At the beginning of the 20th century they enabled workers to leave the more insalubrious districts and buy their own home. Shoebox houses are very characteristic of Montreal. Directed by: Mathieu Baer (Canada, 2019)

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Exploring Saint-Émilion, South-West France. An artist in every sense taking her inspiration from nature, Daniela Busarello is architect, designer, painter, scenographer and landscape designer. Paris, in the footsteps of a French icon: Edith Piaf. Focus on vegetable dyeing by Caroline Courtois. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Ramara, Ontario
Behind the walls of a house: an invasion of bees! Louis will do his best to resolve this case.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Rudimentary cuisine Christian gathers everyone together for a rudimentary meal with a recipe from François Papineau, conserves from Bob le Chef and fondu from Réal Bossé. Mathieu Hébert grills the meat and smokes the fish without a stove or a pan. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: The peony garden Katharina Shepherd spent ten years living in Japan, which was where she developed her passion for peonies. In her magnificent garden with a view of Lake Thun, she grows a range of rare species. Presented by: Katharina Locher.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: In the Gironde, we follow in the footsteps of Montesquieu at the Château de La Brède. Encounter with the architect and designer Aline Asmar d'Amman. Addresses for climbing enthusiasts. On the Bassin d'Arcachon, Marielle Philip, head of Peau Marine, makes leather by tanning fish skins. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Aunis
In the Natural Region of the Aunis, Claire and Vincent gather seaweed from the Pointe du Chay headland, before transforming it into something totally delicious. Benoît and François farm mussels to sample directly on the quayside. We also meet Fabrice, an encounter between surf and turf. All about Surgères butter.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: Dijon: a shrine to owls Dijon is the capital of Burgundy and also the land of the owl! This nocturnal bird is the town's symbol and is found just about everywhere. as a constant source of inspiration for the Dijon's residents! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at the French Senate, a building steeped in history. Ceramists from father to son, we meet François from the Jean Roger family. Three addresses for all fans of turntables and vinyl records. Focus on the chistera, the strange wicker glove emblematic of the Basque game of pelota. Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Pas de description
